info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 11:12AM CDT until April 03 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN WEBSTER...SOUTHWESTERN CLAIBORNE...NORTHWESTERN BIENVILLE AND SOUTHEASTERN BOSSIER PARISHES... At 1112 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Dixie Inn, or near Minden, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Sibley and Heflin around 1115 AM CDT. Minden and Dubberly around 1120 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Gilark, Curtis, Noles Landing, Lake Bistineau North, Holly Springs, Plum Orchard Landing, Ogden, Koran and Ada. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
